title: Trump announces deal to impose 15% tariff on South Korea
byline: President Donald Trump says the US will charge a 15% tariff on imports from South Korea, in what he called a ’’full and complete trade deal’’.

title: Showers expected today in several provinces after 1 p.m
byline: The Forecasting Division of the National Meteorological Centre announced that showers are expected today (31) at several locations in the Northern, North-Central, Central, Uva, and Eastern provinces after 1:00 p.m.

title: President returns from Maldives visit
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this morning (30), concluding a three-day official visit to the Maldives.

title: Canada follows France and UK with plan to recognise Palestinian state
byline: Prime Minister Mark Carney has said Canada plans to recognise a Palestinian state in September, becoming the third G7 nation to make such an announcement in recent days.

title: ’’India, Russia can take their dead economies down together’’: Donald Trump
byline: A day after announcing 25 per cent tariffs on imports of India, US President Donald Trump has dropped another bombshell. Hitting out at India and Russia, he has said he does not care about New Delhi’s dealings with Moscow and that the two ’’can take their dead economies down together’’.

title: Fresh resolution to be moved in September
byline: The United Kingdom, along with the other members of the core-group, will move a fresh resolution to be adopted by the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) at its upcoming session in September with the primary objective of pursuing the Sri Lankan Accountability Project and other remaining matters, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Youth killed in shooting in Kosgoda
byline: A 23-year-old man was shot dead in the Duwamodara area of Kosgoda early this morning (31), police said.

title: First Australian-made rocket crashes shortly after lift-off
byline: The first orbital rocket made and designed in Australia crashed 14 seconds after lift-off during its first test launch.

title: Kerala cannabis worth Rs. 21.6 million seized in Jaffna
byline: A stock of Kerala Cannabis valued at approximately Rs. 21.6 million was seized during a joint operation in the Maruthankerny area in Vaththirayan, Jaffna early this morning (31).

title: Over 30 arrested for soliciting bribes in first half of 2025
byline: A total of 34 individuals have been arrested over bribery-related offences during the first six months of 2025, the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) said.

title: Drone operations suspended during Kandy Esala Perahera
byline: The Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka (CAASL) has announced a temporary suspension of all drone operations over the procession route during the Kandy Esala Perahera, which will be held from July 30 to August 9, 2025.

title: Chief Justice pledges to fast-track court digitalization
byline: Newly appointed Chief Justice Preethi Padman Surasena stated today that he intends to fast-track the digitalization of the court system across the country, emphasising that the time has come to adopt technologically advanced methods in the administration of justice.

title: New salary structure to be introduced for public service: Sub-Committee
byline: The Sub-Committee appointed to seek solutions to the prevailing salary discrepancies and related issues in the public service is expected to submit proposals for the introduction of a new salary structure for the entire public service.

title: CEA urges devotees to minimize plastic waste during Kandy Esala Perahera
byline: The Central Environmental Authority (CEA) has requested all devotees attending the Kandy Esala Perahera to properly dispose of waste and avoid bringing plastic items into the city during the festival, which will take place from July 30 to August 10, 2025.

title: Sotheby’s returns Buddha jewels to India after uproar
byline: Auction house Sotheby’s has returned a set of sacred jewels believed to be linked to the Buddha’s remains to India, after facing mounting pressure from the Indian government and global Buddhist leaders.

title: Mahout assistant’s body found in Kandy lake
byline: The body of a young mahout assistant was discovered floating near the banks of Kandy Lake this morning (31), police confirmed.

title: Rohitha Abeygunawardhana’s daughter granted bail
byline: The daughter of Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Parliamentarian Rohitha Abeygunawardhana has been granted bail by the Mathugama Magistrate’s Court.

title: London’s Heathrow hit by more flight cancellations after air traffic failure
byline: At least 16 flights to and from London’s Heathrow Airport were cancelled on Thursday, a day after technical problems with Britain’s air traffic control system caused widespread disruption across the country’s airports.

title: No fuel price revision for August: CPC
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) announced that there will be no revision in fuel prices for the month of August, as per the prevailing fuel pricing formula.

title: Indictments to be filed against Piumi Hansamali, Thambugala for alleged tax evasion
byline: The Department of Inland Revenue informed Colombo Additional Magistrate Pasan Amarasena that steps are being taken to file indictments before the Colombo High Court against model and actress Piumi Hansamali and Aura Lanka Chairman T.A.C.V. Thambugala for alleged tax evasion.

title: Maho–Anuradhapura rail gets Indian grant boost
byline: The Government of India has released the first instalment of funding—amounting to approximately USD 2.5 million (around LKR 770 million)—for the installation of an advanced signalling and telecommunication system along Sri Lanka’s Maho–Anuradhapura railway line.

title: Land maps online from tomorrow: Survey Department
byline: The Survey Department announced that land maps will be avaliable online from tomorrow (August 1), marking a major step towards digital public services.

title: Over 500 legal cases filed against foreign employment fraudsters in past 7 months: SLBFE
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) announced that 567 court cases have been filed over the past seven months against individuals and unlicensed agencies involved in foreign employment frauds.

title: Draft bill to cut ex-Presidents’ perks gazetted
byline: The gazette of the draft bill aimed at amending the Presidents’ Entitlements Act No. 4 of 1986-reducing special privileges granted to former Presidents, their families, and retired Members of Parliament, has been released.

title: Man sends his secret sex video with his wife to her student, court orders arrest
byline: Colombo Additional Magistrate Kasun Kanchana Dissanayake yesterday ordered to immediately arrest and produce a man accused of secretly recording sexual acts with his wife, a schoolteacher and sending the footage via WhatsApp to one of her students.

title: Rear seat belts mandatory on expressways from tomorrow
byline: Wearing seat belts in the rear seats of all light vehicles travelling on expressways will be mandatory from tomorrow (August 1), the Ministry of Transport and Highways said.

title: Heat index reaches ’Caution Level’ in several parts of SL - Met. Dept.
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a heat index advisory warning that temperatures felt on the human body are expected to rise to ‘Caution Level’ in certain areas today (August 1).

title: CSE wraps up July with strong gains amid renewed buying interest
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) concluded the final trading session of July on a positive trajectory, reflecting investor resilience despite early-session volatility.

title: Digital ID to launch by April 2026 with strong privacy safeguards
byline: The Digital Economy Ministry said that a National Digital Identity (Digital ID) system will be launched by April 2026, with strong emphasis on data privacy and citizen protection.

title: 2008 white van abduction case: Former Army officers acquitted
byline: Colombo Additional Magistrate Pasan Amarasena ordered the release of two former military intelligence officers, Hemachandra Perera and Prabath Duminda Weeraratne, who were suspected of abducting and assaulting a journalist and two state officials in 2008.

title: Tourist raises concerns over Increasing Israeli presence in Arugam Bay
byline: While raising concern over the growing Israeli presence in the popular Sri Lankan coastal town of Arugam Bay, international DJ and tourist Tom Monagle alleged that the Sri Lankan government has been turning a blind eye to the matter.
